IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Saint Mary's School in Raleigh, North Carolina, is an independent, college-preparatory girls boarding and day school dedicated to academic excellence and personal achievement for grades 9 - 12.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Saint Mary's School in Raleigh, North Carolina, is an independent, college-preparatory girls boarding and day school dedicated to academic excellence and personal achievement for grades 9 - 12.
IRS990.Desc: Educational activities and related academic support and aid for 264 students.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Saint Mary's provides provides a boarding program for students and faculty and other auxiliary services to further academic achievement.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Endowed funds may be restricted to a purpose designated by the donor(s) that is consistent with the School's mission, goals and programs, subject to the approval by the Board of Trustees. When the donor(s) does not restrict the use of a named fund, the Head of School and the Board Chair have discretion in allocating these funds. Uses of funds include: financial aid, building maintenance, faculty development and student support services.
Student pre-paid tuition, $858,064; Student service deposits, $54,300; and residential fees & deposits, $6,100
Scholarships, financial statement decreased revenue by $2,100,554
Scholarships; financial statement decreased revenue by $2,100,554
Officer (HOS & CFO) housing & utility benefit of $126,438.

The School does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, mental or physical disability, or any other status protected by applicable law in the administration of its education, admission, financial aid, athletic and other policies and programs. The School does not discriminate against qualified students of any race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, or mental or physical disability in providing the rights, privileges, programs and activities generally accorded or made available to students at the School. This statement is included in advertising in local and regional magazines, on admission materials, in the School's biannual magazine, and on the School's website.

Merit Based Scholarship: limited merit aid opportunities to students who have demonstrated high academic achievement, exemplary leadership, and strong citizenship within the community. In order to be eligible for merit aid, students must meet all priority application deadlines and be in the top tier of the admission pool. Merit awards vary in amounts and requirements. Merit aid is renewed each year if the recipient earns a weighted 3.0 or higher GPA and remains in good standing at Saint Mary's School. Need Based Scholarship: is given to students with a demonstrated need who would not otherwise have been able to afford Saint Mary's School. All need-based financial aid awards are reviewed annually. Applicants and returning students who are interested in need-based financial aid must apply each year with current financial information by the published deadlines. Tuition Remission: for the daughters and stepdaughters of all benefitted employees of the School for 50% of the tuition charges at Saint Mary's School.
The Head of School is provided on-campus housing as well as cleaning services of the house. Her residence is used for many school functions in addition to serving as her personal residence.
4b Monica Gillespie, Head of School, participated in 457(f) plan in the amount of $17,000

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: Constructions, renovation & equipping of Smedes Hall Dormitory and student center; infrastructure; n

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 8b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board of Trustee meetings are documented through minutes taken; minutes are not taken for the individual committee meetings.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Completed form 990 was electronically provided to the Board of Trustees for their review. The Finance Committee had discussion at their committee meeting in April 2017. The return was edited per comments received. The Finance Committee brought a recommendation to the Board of Trustees for Submission of the Form 990 which was approved.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOT members annually sign a Conflict of Interest Policy document and discuss conflict of interest throughout the year as circumstances change.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The process for determining compensation involves compilation of benchmark data and review of the impact on the financial budget which results in recommendations presented to the Board of Trustees for their approval. The most recent position for which this process was done was the Head of School, in Spring 2012, with an effective date of July 1, 2012.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School provides its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements to the public upon request. The list of Board of Trustees is available to the public on the School's web site.
Unrealized gain on cash flow hedge, $127,686 and additional expenses of Officer benefits $126,437
